thread.title: On the agenda: A look at upcoming municipal meetings around Maryland
thread.title_full: On the agenda: A look at upcoming municipal meetings around Maryland

author: Sean Welsh
title: On the agenda: A look at upcoming municipal meetings around Maryland
text:
Here's a glimpse at upcoming meetings and agendas around the region. 
Click the links to find more detailed schedules and agendas from the governments themselves. 
STATE 
Board of Public Works : Meets Wednesday in Annapolis. See the agenda . 
BALTIMORE CITY 
City Council : Meets at 5 p.m. Monday and will consider the proposed contract that would make Interim Police Commissioner Kevin Davis the full-time commissioner. The city's board of estimates will meet Wednesday. 
School board : Committees will meet Tuesday, but the board's next public meeting is Oct. 27. 
BALTIMORE COUNTY 
County Council : Meets at 6 p.m. Monday in Towson to consider increasing the fees that some developers pay when they can't include the required amount of open space in their projects . 
A proposal from Councilman David Marks, a Perry Hall Republican, would increase these open space waiver fees in downtown Towson , which is experiencing a building boom and where the fees are often lower than other parts of the county. While his proposal has support from civic leaders and preservationists, it is opposed by the building industry. 
Board of Education : Meets at 6:30 p.m. Tuesday. On the agenda : the upcoming school year calendar and contracts for the construction of Relay Elementary. 
ANNE ARUNDEL COUNTY 
County Council : Meets at 7 p.m. Monday. The agenda includes bills concerning the zoning ordinance as it pertains to medical marijuana. 
Board of Education : Meets at 7 p.m. Wednesday. The agenda calls for recognitions and presentations. 
Annapolis City Council : Meets next on Oct. 26. 
CARROLL COUNTY 
County commissioners : A number of committees meet this week, including the transportation advisory commission (Monday), planning & zoning (Tuesday), veteran's advisory (Tuesday) and the environmental advisory council (Wednesday). 
Board of Education : Meets again on Nov. 11. 
HARFORD COUNTY 
County Council : Meets at 7 p.m. Tuesday and will discuss enterprise zone tax credits in the greater Aberdeen area, as well as a zoning amendment and a bill concerning conflicts of interest. Prior to that, a 6 p.m. public hearing will address fire hydrants and zoning. 
Board of Education : Meets again on Oct. 26. 
Aberdeen City Council : Meets at 7 p.m. Monday and will discuss enterprise tax credits, a preliminary plan for Stadium Towne Center and public works projects. Council will also recognize two Heritage Trust Beautification Award winners, and announce details for the Nov. 3 election. 
Town of Bel Air : Town commissioners do not have an agenda posted online, but the historic preservation commission considers new business. 
Havre de Grace City Council : Meets at 7 p.m. Monday and will discuss the city's water treatment plant and off-street parking, as well as make four appointments to boards and commissions. Additionally, the mayor will proclaim October "Fire prevention month." Prior to that, a public hearing will address waterfront property and land acquisition . 
HOWARD COUNTY 
County Council : Meets on Monday. The council host both a public hearing and a work session to discuss affordable housing in Columbia. 
Board of Education : Will gather at 3 p.m. Thursday for a regular meeting.
